content:
• release retro
    • https://github.com/rust-lang/release-team/issues/17
  • Blog post/relnotes assignment
@T-release meeting!
(eventually I'll learn not to write o/ for release meetings)
All right - let's get started
I think release overall went pretty ok - there was some trouble with rustfmt and RLS during beta promotion
But rustfmt is on track to being fixed
And RLS is because toolstatw doesn't track parallel (alt) builders.
https://github.com/rust-lang/release-team/issues/17 is probably best for largely async discussion but would be good to get comments/thoughts there
I think the minimal change of just mentioning existence of beta + nightly seems like a good idea.
(in stable release blog posts)
Alright
perhaps we could do non-blog promotion once we have a relnotes PR
"here's what's coming up, please try it in beta!"
it might also lead to less confusion on "when my change is hitting stable" questions
Yeah, I think there's some lightweight options that might be feasible

Alright, @triagebot end-topic

Leave thoughts on promotion on the issue, and we can check back in next week

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
Ok, blog post + relnotes work for this cycle
(I'll handle the release itself)
Last cycle we had @tmandry do blog post, and I did release notes
if we stick to the 3-way rotation, I'm up for relnotes
ok -- I think that means I'll do blog, right?
yeah
i wonder if we should experiment by allowing newcomers to write a blog post, or at least part of it
ok, great, I can do that.
volunteer: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/241545-t-release/topic/meeting.202022.2001.2021/near/268952626
Depending on when we have release notes I'd be up for a trial post on internals asking for material -- I'm still a little hesitant to hand out time sensitive tasks personally
But I'll reach out to them first maybe and see if we can sync up briefly :)
ok -- and I kicked off crater and will probably have time to triage those results
@triagebot end-meeting ?

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
i'm assuming we are not expected to do a 2022 roadmap like the other teams? (though i don't see much in it, but just asking)
I don't think there's any expectation, no -- if you have ideas on what to put on it I'd be up for kicking off a doc though :)
Alright, thanks all! :wave:
